newsitem.title: CANADA: Derlan gets C$42 mln in aerospace orders.
newsitem.headline: Derlan gets C$42 mln in aerospace orders.

text.p: Derlan Industries Ltd said on Wednesday that its aerospace division in Milton, Ontario had entered into a C$42 million letter of agreement to manufacture and supply parts for a U.S.-based aircraft engine company.

The letter of intent signed between Derlan and GE Aircraft Engines of Cincinnati, Ohio, calls for the delivery of 600 accessory gearboxes and 600 power take-off assemblies for CF34 turbofan engines, Derlan said.
The CF34 is used on the Canadair regional and challenger jets.
The agreement is the second order under Derlan's CF34 program and brings the company's overall backlog to C$416 million at November 30, 1996, Derlan said.
Delivery of the parts is expected to begin in 1997 and run through the year 2000, the company added.
